instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-02016  Air M1  (no image, then after some repair No backlight)
threads.message:
Was given to me as "no image"
LP679 melt down and UP700 smoked!
After the repair I got image but no back light.

Trouble shooting no back light.
UP800  / swapped
BKLT_EN_R 1.8v
BKLT_SD 12V "not pulling down"  Resistors checked. 
QP800 tested / swapped.
power rails present.

I have Isolated BKLT_SD from
QP800.  voltage floats to 4v on BKLT_SD and 10v shows up on the buck converter so QP800 turned on.

UP800 even when replaced and getting a enable signal from the PMIC UP800 refuses to pull down BKLT_SD and turn on QP800 and pulse QP801.  What am I missing here?

threads.title: 820-02016  Air M1  (no image, then after some repair No backlight)
threads.message: Apart of enable signal, UP800 requires correct I2C_BKLT_SCL/SDA communication with LCD assembly.

threads.title: 820-02016  Air M1  (no image, then after some repair No backlight)
threads.message:
I ohm checked the two SDA lines to JP600
I2C_DISP_BKLT_SCL
I2C_DISP_BKLT_SDA
(good)
.
the SDA lines make good contact with JP600   The resistors on those lines. RP850-RP853 are all good.   Not sure what else I can check here.
I will get out the scope.

threads.title: 820-02016  Air M1  (no image, then after some repair No backlight)
threads.message: I am just going to trash this machine and move in

threads.title: 820-02016  Air M1  (no image, then after some repair No backlight)
threads.message: Did you try known good LCD assembly?
